channel.title: Comments on: Blue Iris 3 and Samsung SmartCam SNH-1011N

item.title: By: Aaron
item.dc:creator: Aaron
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/blog/index.php/archives/1963/comment-page-1#comment-43112">Allison Rose</a>.
OK? "Every camera model?" I'm extremely skeptical.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Allison Rose.

OK? “Every camera model?” I’m extremely skeptical.

item.title: By: Allison Rose
item.dc:creator: Allison Rose
item.description: I use IP Camera Viewer with the Y-Cam cameras. It has a built in profile for every camera model
item.content:encoded: I use IP Camera Viewer with the Y-Cam cameras. It has a built in profile for every camera model

item.title: By: Aaron
item.dc:creator: Aaron
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/blog/index.php/archives/1963/comment-page-1#comment-42047">Jon</a>.
Excellent question -- I thought I'd mentioned it ... I looked at the network traffic using a tool called Wireshark. That may have been unnecessarily complex, but I knew how to use it. :)
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Jon.

Excellent question — I thought I’d mentioned it … I looked at the network traffic using a tool called Wireshark. That may have been unnecessarily complex, but I knew how to use it. :)

item.title: By: Jon
item.dc:creator: Jon
item.description: How did you figure out what the video path was in the first place? Is there a list of variables that can be used?
item.content:encoded: How did you figure out what the video path was in the first place? Is there a list of variables that can be used?

item.title: By: Aaron
item.dc:creator: Aaron
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/blog/index.php/archives/1963/comment-page-1#comment-42041">Jon</a>.
Odd, I don't have an unreasonable delay in the first place in my setup. However, thanks for the tip as it might help someone else! :)
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Jon.

Odd, I don’t have an unreasonable delay in the first place in my setup. However, thanks for the tip as it might help someone else! :)

item.title: By: Jon
item.dc:creator: Jon
item.description: I played around with the setting and now have it down to about 1-2 sec delay using the video path of "/profile2/media.smp". I tried using "profile1" instead but ended up with most of the screen green with just the top viewable. 2 seems to be the magic number with minimal delay.
item.content:encoded: I played around with the setting and now have it down to about 1-2 sec delay using the video path of “/profile2/media.smp”. I tried using “profile1” instead but ended up with most of the screen green with just the top viewable. 2 seems to be the magic number with minimal delay.

item.title: By: Jon
item.dc:creator: Jon
item.description: I'm getting 10-12 secs delays using this setup compared to only 1-2 secs when viewing through the SmartCam app. Any ideas why this feed method is so slow? People are at my front door or in my garage for more than 10 secs before I even see them. Many times already gone before I know they were there in the first place.
item.content:encoded: I’m getting 10-12 secs delays using this setup compared to only 1-2 secs when viewing through the SmartCam app. Any ideas why this feed method is so slow? People are at my front door or in my garage for more than 10 secs before I even see them. Many times already gone before I know they were there in the first place.
